data.title: Best Thai food in town
data.text:
We just love this place! 
My husband and I been visiting this places since 2005! We keep coming back with friend and family, we like tha Mango Paradise plate!

data.title: Changed my world!
data.text: I would have had no idea what the order, but luckily I was with friends in the area. We ordered about six different dishes and two appetizers and split them all. There was not one item that was not incredible! I would highly recommend this place if you're in town or are a local!

data.title: Yummy Thai!
data.text: Very nice ,pleasant, and clean atmosphere, good food, and a friendly wait staff.  What more do you need?

data.title: Tasty food, great service
data.text: The food was delicious and great service.  Ambiance could use some work but may not be that type of establishment/needed

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We love their curry (pumpkin is fav) and their brown rice is hearty and nutty. Best Thai food in Tracy. Favorite spot for a healthy dinner .

data.title: Excellent cuisine and atmosphere
data.text:
We frequent this restaurant. The staff is very friendly, the food is excellent, the room is beautiful and they generally have pleasing music playing. 
The dishes are not super-spicy unless requested. The appetizers are quite good, also.  All in all it is a relaxing and inviting establishment.

data.title: Excellent food, one of my favorite local restaurants
data.text: I love the food here.  The portions are just about perfect and the flavors are excellent.  Restaurant seems clean, the decor is tasteful.  Not a fan of the wicker chairs, but whatever.  The service is hit or miss sometimes.

data.title: Worth the Return!
data.text: My friend introduced me to this restaurant the first time I went to Tracy. Upon a return trip, I definitely had to make this my first stop! Great service, affordable food.

data.title: Reasonable tasty Thai food
data.text: This is my go to place for their Thai chicken salad. They also have beef and shrimp. I like the fact that you can pick the spicyness of your salad toppings from mild to hot!!!

data.title: Cute place good service
data.text: Nice décor & good service, food is tasty.  Good lunch specials & my family loves there yellow curry, with potato.  A little dark inside, but very well kept.

data.title: Pad thai, grilled pork, crunchy rolls
data.text: One of my favorite Thai restaurants. Service is great, restaurant is nicely themed so it can be a great choice for a romantic dinner. Went here with the family for lunch, at another time with spouse for a quiet dinner. Everything we ordered tasted great and looked appetizing.  They also used the nice Thai serving bowls.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: We were quite a large group for a family get together. Our service was amazing, it was fast and very efficient.  The menu was quite varied, every one of us loved our selections.  From the seafood to the vegetarian.   The portions were generous.  We are adding this place to our list of favorites in Tracy

data.title: Best Thai food in central valley
data.text: I love this place, The yellow curry are the best and their mango delight . Good place for large groups and very reasonable prices.

data.title: Best Thai in Town
data.text: I have lived in Tracy for way too long and this is the best Thai in town. The Pad Thai and the Yellow Curry are my favorites. You can eat in or get them to go. My wife likes the Panang Gai which is a very flavorful curry. This place is super inexpensive and the food far exceeds the price.

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text: I give this restaurant 3 stars because sometimes its been very good and others just so, so.  We recently went and had oriental chicken salads....just so, so.  While another time we had one of the specials, Asparagus chicken/veggie plate and this was very good.  There are other Thai restaurants in town that are always very good, so this type of inconsistent food does not make me want to go back.

data.title: Great Thai food
data.text: Tracy Thai is the best Thai food in the area. The restaurant is comfortable and inviting and the wait staff is great. I recommend the chicken satay, num sod and yellow curry.

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: New place and while Tracy has many Thai restaurants, Tracy Thai is different. It is quiet and good for a more leisurely lunch

data.title: First visit was very good. Second and last visit was not.
data.text:
First visit was very good. I was here with my daughter,  who's very picky about food and she liked it too.  Food was good and service was good. Prices were fair.

My second visit was by myself.  Wasn't sure if I wanted take out or eat in.  I decided to eat in and was seated right away.  But changed my mind and decided to take out and the waitress looked pissed off at me and took the setting and the water away immediately.

Ultimately, I chose to stay after all and the rest of the meal was awful.  The waitress took 15 minutes to come back to take my order, it took 15 to get my order, I had to ask for the water back, when the food came, which was really good, I had to ask for the place setting.  Either the waitress had a bad day or my indecision pissed her off.

Needless to say, she got a minimal tip and I've never been back.  Thai Cafe, down the street, is way better and the service there has always been exceptional.  Atmosphere is way better. 

Hopefully for Tracy Thai, that waitress is not working for them anymore.  But I don't know since I've never been back.

data.title: Great Thai food in nice atmosphere
data.text: A spacious nicely decorated restaurant. Friendly and efficient staff and very good real Thai food, as confirmed by my Thai partner: it was real and the best she had in the US so far. And the price was right too.

data.title: Good Food, slow service
data.text:
This evening, we decided to go out for supper and decided to try the Tracy Thai Restaurant here in town, which we have been to on numerous previous occasions.  We left at 6:30PM and on the way over, I imagined that the place would be jam-packed, being that it's supper time.  

When we arrived, the place looked empty and initially, I thought they might be closed.  Because the interior of the restaurant “has soft lighting” it appeared dark from the street.  I then noticed there was another family and a couple dining inside.  

Doesn't anyone eat supper anymore?  Unlike the 70s and 80s, when I was growing up, supper was customarily around 5-7PM, but I guess with today’s uncertain economy working families eat at different times in order to accommodate their busy schedules.  

Upon entering, we were received right away and seated at a corner table.  The inside of this restaurant always reminds me of Hawaii, because the interior décor has that Polynesian appearance.  

It didn't take us more than a couple of minutes to decide on what we wanted to order, however it took about 15 minutes before anyone responded to our table.  I assumed that since there were only a total of three families and three servers, the service would be a little faster. 

When our server did finally respond, she was welcoming and took our order but when I asked her what type of “soup” she could recommend, she said, “I don’t know, I’m new here.”  So I guess soup was out!  “I’m thinking, maybe you should know these things because customers will usually go by what they recommend… or in this case, not.”

We ordered the crispy Eggrolls as an appetizer for starters, along with Prawn Pad Thai, Prawn Fried Rice, Chicken Curry, and another Chicken Appetizer.  “Can you tell, we like chicken and prawns?”

The crispy egg rolls came first and as advertised, they were crispy, well cooked and pretty good.  The Eggrolls came with a fish dipping sauce or at least that's what it tasted like but milder.  The sauce really complimented the Eggrolls and gave it a little tangy sweet flavor.  It didn't take long to finish the plate.  

Next came the Chicken Curry followed by the Prawn Fried Rice.  I thought the curry came out a little thin on the consommé side, but there was no objections in the flavor. 

The Prawn Fried Rice was delightful but then again, I've always been partial to fried rice.  The next dish was the Prawn Pad Thai, which was another wonderful dish and went well with the fried rice.  Our server was more attentive, replenishing our glasses with water and we enjoyed the rest of our meal. 

Upon completing our supper, I waited for ten minute before I gestured for our waitress for the check.  By this time, there wasn’t anyone else in the restaurant other than one person who came in for take-out.  

Our waitress looked over at our table then continued to carry on a conversation with her co-worker.  “I guess I’m just the intolerant type.”

Our bill came out to $43.00 and some change and the overall dining experience here for the third time in as many years was very enjoyable.  Everyone one of the dishes were prepared well and no one conveyed any criticisms.  

We will continue to dine at this delightful restaurant notwithstanding the slow service.  The waitress, although acknowledging that she was new to the restaurant, instead of carrying on a conversation with her co-worker, she should have taken the time and studied the menu or asked the cook what types of “soup” they carried and what was recommended!
